1.text: Scrape any leftover food into the trash or garbage disposal.

2.text: Fill your sink halfway with hot water and add 1 US tbsp (15 ml) of dish soap.

3.text: Work from lightly to heavily soiled dishes.

4.text: Scrub your dishes underwater with a sponge or dishcloth.

5.text: Rinse off the soap with hot water.

6.text: Let the dishes dry on a rack or a clean towel.

7.text: Rinse off your sink after you put your dishes away.

8.text: Get rid of any leftover food on your dishes and rinse them off.

9.text: Put cups, small bowls, and plastics on the top shelf of your dishwasher.

10.text: Load plates, serving bowls, and other larger cookware on the bottom rack.

11.text: Put the utensils into the basket on the bottom rack or door.

12.text: Fill the designated compartment with a detergent made for use in a dishwasher.

14.text: Pour hot water into the skillet immediately after you’re done using it.

15.text: Scrub off excess food with a new sponge or stiff-bristled brush.

16.text: Dry the skillet on the stovetop.

17.text: Rub vegetable oil into the skillet with a paper towel.
